title: How to Wear a Hair Ribbon Inspired by New York Fashion Week’s Fall 2017 Shows
text: The Best Real-Girl Lessons on Wearing a Hair Ribbon Come From Instagram February 16, 2017 11:37 PM 1 / 5 Photo: Curtesy of Pandora Sykes / @pandorasykes Of all the beauty statements at New York Fashion Week this season, one look stood out on the runways, winning over front row stylists and editors alike: the hair ribbon. First spotted at Tory Burch , with Marchesa following suit, the accessory has an unusual ability to pair elegance with ease. But the hair ribbon trend isn’t limited to the runway. In fact, the pretty loops strips are everywhere, and a quick glance at Instagram provides some how-to inspiration for adapting them to suit your personal style. Take model Coco Baudelle, who paired a thin, jet-hued ribbon around loose waves with a diaphanous silk number for a look right out of Picnic at Hanging Rock . Or, look to British stylist Martha Ward’s star-spangled version wrapped around a low-slung ponytail, instantly adding a touch of sparkle to her monochromatic outfit. Beyond pure simplicity, hair ribbons are remarkably versatile. Riley Keough’s stylist Jamie Mizrahi snapped the Hollywood starlet’s Golden Globes look : a classic French Twist with a modern upgrade thanks to a black bow of epic proportions. But the simple swath of fabric also works perfectly beachside: Pandora Sykes repurposed a Chanel trimming—let your mind go aflutter with dreams of what it once wrapped—to pull back her wet lengths into a sleek chignon post-dip. Instantly elevating your look with zero effort? We’re sold.
